titleStmt.title: W. E. Scott et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11303

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the honorable Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

We the undersigned your petitioner, would repectfully state that at the Spring term Fall term 1861 of the Carroll Circuit court judgment was rendered agst A. J. Guthrie for the sum of three hundred Dollars on a forfeited recognizance. The Bond was taken before an examining court in which the principal Willis Whitaker was held over for passing Counterfeit money. The circumstances make it doubtful whether upon Correction trial a conviction would have resulted -- The principal Willis Whitaker is a very young man and now in the service of the Federal army and has not been heard from for some time rendering it probable that he has fallen by disease or otherwise -- A. J. Guthrie is a poor man and not able to pay the judgment without greatly reducing his means of support -- We believe the govern Comwth will be more benefited by realising releasing the forfeiture than by enforcing it We therefore pray your excellency to remit said forfeiture.

W E Scott
H W Pryor
A J Guthrie
B B Elston
John Hogan
Smith Wingate
E. J Nuttall
P. U. Major
W. M. Fisher
Jim Pryor
H. W. Bosworth
I M Collyer
John Dean
Moses Spicer
M Burett
P. O. Turpin
J A. Stringfellow
W. H. Turpin
J. J. Hayden
H. H. Turpin

M B

D W Hayes
Carter

Thomas
Thos. D. Wright
W. Com
Jno. J. Orr
Wm Spicer

J. A. Crawford

M, S, Brown

Carroll Cir. Ct
$300. } Recognizance
A. J Guthrie
Remission Issd Apr 9. 1862
